title: Energy conservation - ion source and uniform field

content.question: The figure shows an apparatus that consists of an ion source on the left and a region of uniform electric field on the right. In the ion source, ions of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> and charge <math alttext="positive e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>e</mi></math> are created at the far left end, accelerate from rest through a potential difference <math alttext="negative uppercase V sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mpadded></math>, and exit the source. The ions then move a short distance at a constant velocity from the source into the region of uniform electric field.
